entry.title: Action over Words
entry.content:
This recent article by DHH resonates with me pretty significantly, actions > arguments.

As my mom put it‚Ä¶ ‚Äúactions speak louder than words.‚Äù

When it comes to engineering, doing beats talking. Many organizations (think big corporations) are paralyzed by non-action, or too many words spoken and not enough fingers on keyboards.

The ‚Äòbloatifcation‚Äô of engineering teams starts by inaction, a lot of talk, not a lot of doing. What happens after, is anyone‚Äôs guess.

Talk is cheap. If you say you‚Äôre going to do something, make sure you follow through with action.

entry.title: Heroku
entry.content:
Finding out about Heroku removing the free tier does sting a bit. Being one of the first PaaS services I ever used, it‚Äôs a little sad to see it go. I wonder if free PaaS is a pipe dream? At some point free becomes impossible. I am sure there will be others to give it a shot‚Ä¶ but for how long? We need to be able to be flexible, learn to pivot if need be or just pay up. So, here‚Äôs one ‚òï Heroku, thanks for making your free tier service, it was great while it lasted.

Alternatives

Render

I have not used Render, but it looks like it can do just about all what Heroku does (Host rails, php, nodejs, etc.. with a free tier).

https://render.com/

AWS

Aws has a free tier. It might more complex, but you can get something up and running for free using a myriad of services:

  • AWS BeanStalk
  • AWS S3
  • AWS EC2
  • AWS RDS

Netlify

Reminds me of Divshot ü™¶ (who remembers that?) great for static hosting, free.

https://www.netlify.com/

Github Pages

I personally use Github Pages. It‚Äôs great, it‚Äôs fast and easy to get your static store hosted!

https://pages.github.com/

entry.title: Mastermind
entry.content:
My kids and I love to play games, one of our favorites is Mastermind. Unfortunately, we were missing lots of pegs‚Ä¶ We‚Äôd come up with interesting ways to account for this, in which inspired me to write our own version. We‚Äôd love to share it with you‚Ä¶

Play Mastermind

It‚Äôs open source on github!

How to play

Click a gray space, then pick a color on the left. Once you have 4 color spaces, press ‚Äúscore‚Äù to see your score for that row. For more detailed instructions: https://www.wikihow.com/Play-Mastermind

Scoring

Each white peg means that one of the guessed pegs is correct, but is in the wrong hole. Each red (or black) peg means that one of the guessed pegs is correct, and is in the right hole. The order of the white and black pegs does not matter.

End

If you guess the correct code, you win!

Restart

Refresh your browser for a new game.
